definitions.definition: To bribe, especially to deter oversight.
definitions.example: I thought the guards would give us trouble, but apparently he had paid them off.

definitions.definition: To become worthwhile; to produce a net benefit.
definitions.example: Her years of Spanish classes finally paid off when she found herself in Mexico and realized she could communicate with people.
He paid off the loan three months early.

definitions.definition: To pay back (repay, pay off) the entirety of a loan, thereby effecting the release of a lien on.
definitions.example: This contract requires you to pay off the car by 2025.

definitions.definition: To fall to leeward, as the head of a vessel under sail.
